description: From Latin inofficiōsus. Compare French inofficieux. See in- (“not”) +‎ officious.

adjectives.description: inofficious (comparative more inofficious, superlative most inofficious)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Not officious; not civil or attentive.
(obsolete, law) Contrary to one's natural obligation or duty, as of a testament by which a child is unjustly deprived of inheritance.
examples: an inofficious disposition of his fortune
